intro: Lepidococcus subinermis, commonly known as the smooth lepidococcus, is a small, annual herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are borne in dense inflorescences. Lepidococcus subinermis is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
